### initialize() {#a323a4c1032fc5346fac2a3a3f00b7ade}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;AMDGPUAttributor.cpp&#125;::AAAMDMaxNumWorkgroups::initialize (<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/attributor">Attributor</a> &amp; A)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Initialize the state with the information in the Attributor <code>A</code>.

This function is called by the Attributor once all abstract attributes have been identified. It can and shall be used for task like:
<ul>
<li>identify existing knowledge in the IR and use it for the &quot;known state&quot;</li>
<li>perform any work that is not going to change over time, e.g., determine a subset of the IR, or attributes in-flight, that have to be looked at in the <code>updateImpl</code> method.</li>
</ul>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgpuattributor-cpp/#l01010">1010</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgpuattributor-cpp">AMDGPUAttributor.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### manifest() {#a858b2d1d8e8f50fb043e650fb6197d91}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ChangeStatus anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;AMDGPUAttributor.cpp&#125;::AAAMDMaxNumWorkgroups::manifest (<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/attributor">Attributor</a> &amp; A)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Hook for the Attributor to trigger the manifestation of the information represented by the abstract attribute in the LLVM-IR.

\\Return CHANGED if the IR was altered, otherwise UNCHANGED.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgpuattributor-cpp/#l01055">1055</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgpuattributor-cpp">AMDGPUAttributor.cpp</a>.

### trackStatistics() {#ada3581d0062b9fc18f02ad9a6b1f3fc1}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;AMDGPUAttributor.cpp&#125;::AAAMDMaxNumWorkgroups::trackStatistics () const</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Hook to enable custom statistic tracking, called after manifest that resulted in a change if statistics are enabled.

We require subclasses to provide an implementation so we remember to add statistics for them.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgpuattributor-cpp/#l01088">1088</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgpuattributor-cpp">AMDGPUAttributor.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### updateImpl() {#a78b300aeab76328894717218a55b32d1}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ChangeStatus anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;AMDGPUAttributor.cpp&#125;::AAAMDMaxNumWorkgroups::updateImpl (<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/attributor">Attributor</a> &amp; A)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
The actual update/transfer function which has to be implemented by the derived classes.

If it is called, the environment has changed and we have to determine if the current information is still valid or adjust it otherwise.

\\Return CHANGED if the internal state changed, otherwise UNCHANGED.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgpuattributor-cpp/#l01024">1024</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgpuattributor-cpp">AMDGPUAttributor.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
